definition: to love to hear and see (idiom)/well received/to one's liking
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen
music
happy/cheerful/to laugh
surname Yue
surname Le
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: This is a literary and artistic work loved by the masses.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部为群众所喜闻乐见的文艺作品。

sentences.english: Tug-of-war is also one of the most popular sports in China.
sentences.chinese: 而拔河应该算是大家最喜闻乐见的一项体育活动。

sentences.english: A successful child, though — that's relatable and desirable.
sentences.chinese: 然而一个成功的孩子就令人喜闻乐见了。

sentences.english: Our literature and art must be popular among the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们的文艺必须为大众所喜闻乐见。

sentences.english: Story-telling is a folk art much loved by the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 说书是中国人喜闻乐见的民间艺术。

sentences.english: The er ren zhuan, or two-person skit, has gained in popularly among the Chinese recently.
sentences.chinese: 最近，二人转已为中国老百姓所喜闻乐见。
